comments.body: This seems to be the only difference between `test-runtime` and `test-runtime-no-opt`. Why not use an additional parameter `opt` next to `gc` and `build-mode` instead?

In Travis CI there were 6 no-opt tests in total debug + release-fast with immix GC for each version. 
Using this here would produce 18 tests (3 versions * 3 GC * 2 debug modes). 
We can add them using `include` clause but it would take much place in yaml since we need to set each parameter in the matrix. Same if we would use `exclude` as when creating holes in `test-runtime`. Also, each change in the matrix parameters list, like a new field, would result in the need to fix all of them. 

Although this duplication might look redundant in my opinion it's easier to maintain in the longer term.
